title: Famous Fashion Designer Paul Costelloe Passes Away
summary: Paul Costelloe, a famous Irish fashion designer, has died at age 80 in London after a short illness. He was surrounded by his family. Costelloe was born in Dublin and studied fashion design in Paris. He started his own fashion label in 1979 and showed his clothes at big fashion events in London, Paris, Milan, and New York. He was the personal designer for Princess Diana, which made him very well-known. Costelloe loved using Irish fabrics like linen and tweed in his designs. He also worked with stores and was part of Ireland Fashion Week. Some people were upset when he said Irish women lacked style, but he later said Ireland had become more European. The Irish prime minister said he was sad and called Costelloe an icon who brought Irish fashion to the world.

background_read: Paul Costelloe was an Irish fashion designer born in Dublin. He learned fashion design in Paris and started his own clothing brand. He became famous for designing clothes for Princess Diana and using traditional Irish materials. Fashion designers create clothes that people wear, and they often show their work at big events called fashion weeks. Costelloe's work helped people around the world learn about Irish fashion.
